channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: ZS-VCOS: Zero-Shot Outperforms Supervised Video Camouflaged Object Segmentation with Zero-Shot Method
item.description: Our method integrates optical flow, a vision-language model, and SAM 2 into a sequential pipeline, where the output of one component provides cues for the next.

item.title: Machine Learning Models for Soil Parameter Prediction Based on Satellite, Weather, Clay and Yield Data
item.description: Efficient nutrient management and precise fertilization are essential for advancing modern agriculture, particularly in regions striving to optimize crop yields sustainably.

item.title: MixFunn: A Neural Network for Differential Equations with Improved Generalization and Interpretability
item.description: We introduce MixFunn, a novel neural network architecture designed to solve differential equations with enhanced precision, interpretability, and generalization capability.

item.title: STADE: Standard Deviation as a Pruning Metric
item.description: Building upon Wanda's work, this study provides a theoretical explanation of why the method is effective and leverages these insights to enhance the pruning process.

item.title: Improving Low-Resource Retrieval Effectiveness using Zero-Shot Linguistic Similarity Transfer
item.description: We find that this approach improves the performance of the varieties upon which the models were directly trained, thereby regularising these models to generalise and perform better even on unseen language variety pairs.

item.title: Preference-based Learning with Retrieval Augmented Generation for Conversational Question Answering
item.description: Conversational Question Answering (ConvQA) involves multiple subtasks, i) to understand incomplete questions in their context, ii) to retrieve relevant information, and iii) to generate answers.

item.title: SKDU at De-Factify 4.0: Natural Language Features for AI-Generated Text-Detection
item.description: The rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) has introduced new challenges in distinguishing human-written text from AI-generated content.

item.title: CPPO: Accelerating the Training of Group Relative Policy Optimization-Based Reasoning Models
item.description: This paper introduces Completion Pruning Policy Optimization (CPPO) to accelerate the training of reasoning models based on Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO).

item.title: CoSIL: Software Issue Localization via LLM-Driven Code Repository Graph Searching
item.description: CoSIL reduces the search space through module call graphs, iteratively searches the function call graph to obtain relevant contexts, and uses context pruning to control the search direction and manage contexts effectively.

item.title: AdaRank: Adaptive Rank Pruning for Enhanced Model Merging
item.description: Model merging has emerged as a promising approach for unifying independently fine-tuned models into an integrated framework, significantly enhancing computational efficiency in multi-task learning.

item.title: Historical Ink: Exploring Large Language Models for Irony Detection in 19th-Century Spanish
item.description: This study explores the use of large language models (LLMs) to enhance datasets and improve irony detection in 19th-century Latin American newspapers.

item.title: MO-CTranS: A unified multi-organ segmentation model learning from multiple heterogeneously labelled datasets
item.description: Our method was evaluated and compared to several baseline models and state-of-the-art (SOTA) solutions on abdominal MRI datasets that were acquired in different views (i. e. axial and coronal) and annotated for different organs (i. e. liver, kidney, spleen).

item.title: Q-Insight: Understanding Image Quality via Visual Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Image quality assessment (IQA) focuses on the perceptual visual quality of images, playing a crucial role in downstream tasks such as image reconstruction, compression, and generation.

item.title: VITAL: More Understandable Feature Visualization through Distribution Alignment and Relevant Information Flow
item.description: Feature visualization (FV) is a powerful tool to decode what information neurons are responding to and hence to better understand the reasoning behind such networks.

item.title: A Causal Framework to Measure and Mitigate Non-binary Treatment Discrimination
item.description: Fairness studies of algorithmic decision-making systems often simplify complex decision processes, such as bail or loan approvals, into binary classification tasks.

item.title: CFiCS: Graph-Based Classification of Common Factors and Microcounseling Skills
item.description: Common factors and microcounseling skills are critical to the effectiveness of psychotherapy.

item.title: Supposedly Equivalent Facts That Aren't? Entity Frequency in Pre-training Induces Asymmetry in LLMs
item.description: Specifically, we demonstrate that an asymmetry exists in the recognition of logically equivalent facts, which can be attributed to frequency discrepancies of entities appearing as subjects versus objects.

item.title: Spend Your Budget Wisely: Towards an Intelligent Distribution of the Privacy Budget in Differentially Private Text Rewriting
item.description: The task of $\textit{Differentially Private Text Rewriting}$ is a class of text privatization techniques in which (sensitive) input textual documents are $\textit{rewritten}$ under Differential Privacy (DP) guarantees.

item.title: Data-Free Universal Attack by Exploiting the Intrinsic Vulnerability of Deep Models
item.description: Based on this observation, we leverage the ill-conditioned nature of the linear components by aligning the UAP with the right singular vectors corresponding to the maximum singular value of each linear layer.

item.title: Exploring the Effectiveness of Multi-stage Fine-tuning for Cross-encoder Re-rankers
item.description: State-of-the-art cross-encoders can be fine-tuned to be highly effective in passage re-ranking.

item.title: ActionStudio: A Lightweight Framework for Data and Training of Action Models
item.description: Action models are essential for enabling autonomous agents to perform complex tasks.

item.title: Why Stop at One Error? Benchmarking LLMs as Data Science Code Debuggers for Multi-Hop and Multi-Bug Errors
item.description: LLMs are transforming software development, yet current code generation and code repair benchmarks mainly assess syntactic and functional correctness in simple, single-error cases.

item.title: EgoToM: Benchmarking Theory of Mind Reasoning from Egocentric Videos
item.description: We introduce EgoToM, a new video question-answering benchmark that extends Theory-of-Mind (ToM) evaluation to egocentric domains.

item.title: Using AI to Summarize US Presidential Campaign TV Advertisement Videos, 1952-2012
item.description: This paper introduces the largest and most comprehensive dataset of US presidential campaign television advertisements, available in digital format.

item.title: Landscape of Thoughts: Visualizing the Reasoning Process of Large Language Models
item.description: We showcase this advantage by adapting our tool to a lightweight verifier that evaluates the correctness of reasoning paths.

item.title: Fuzzy Cluster-Aware Contrastive Clustering for Time Series
item.description: To address these issues, we propose a fuzzy cluster-aware contrastive clustering framework (FCACC) that jointly optimizes representation learning and clustering.

item.title: Unicorn: Text-Only Data Synthesis for Vision Language Model Training
item.description: By eliminating the dependency on real images while maintaining data quality and diversity, our framework offers a cost-effective and scalable solution for VLMs training.

item.title: FLIP: Towards Comprehensive and Reliable Evaluation of Federated Prompt Learning
item.description: The increasing emphasis on privacy and data security has driven the adoption of federated learning, a decentralized approach to train machine learning models without sharing raw data.

item.title: EndoLRMGS: Complete Endoscopic Scene Reconstruction combining Large Reconstruction Modelling and Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Additionally, EndoLRMGS improves the PSNR of the tools projection from 3. 82% to 11. 07%.

item.title: A Refined Analysis of Massive Activations in LLMs
item.description: Motivated in part by their relevance for low-precision training and quantization, massive activations in large language models (LLMs) have recently emerged as a topic of interest.

item.title: consexpressionR: an R package for consensus differential gene expression analysis
item.description: Motivation: Bulk RNA-Seq is a widely used method for studying gene expression across a variety of contexts.

item.title: UGNA-VPR: A Novel Training Paradigm for Visual Place Recognition Based on Uncertainty-Guided NeRF Augmentation
item.description: This paper introduces a novel training paradigm to improve the performance of existing VPR networks by enhancing multi-view diversity within current datasets through uncertainty estimation and NeRF-based data augmentation.

item.title: AdaMHF: Adaptive Multimodal Hierarchical Fusion for Survival Prediction
item.description: Furthermore, we introduce a survival prediction benchmark designed to resolve scenarios with missing modalities, mirroring real-world clinical conditions.

item.title: Vision Language Models versus Machine Learning Models Performance on Polyp Detection and Classification in Colonoscopy Images
item.description: Introduction: This study provides a comprehensive performance assessment of vision-language models (VLMs) against established convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and classic machine learning models (CMLs) for computer-aided detection (CADe) and computer-aided diagnosis (CADx) of colonoscopy polyp images.

item.title: BOOTPLACE: Bootstrapped Object Placement with Detection Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we tackle the copy-paste image-to-image composition problem with a focus on object placement learning.

item.title: OntoAligner: A Comprehensive Modular and Robust Python Toolkit for Ontology Alignment
item.description: Ontology Alignment (OA) is fundamental for achieving semantic interoperability across diverse knowledge systems.

item.title: Data-Agnostic Robotic Long-Horizon Manipulation with Vision-Language-Guided Closed-Loop Feedback
item.description: Recent advances in language-conditioned robotic manipulation have leveraged imitation and reinforcement learning to enable robots to execute tasks from human commands.

item.title: Pretrained Bayesian Non-parametric Knowledge Prior in Robotic Long-Horizon Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Reinforcement learning (RL) methods typically learn new tasks from scratch, often disregarding prior knowledge that could accelerate the learning process.

item.title: Embodied-Reasoner: Synergizing Visual Search, Reasoning, and Action for Embodied Interactive Tasks
item.description: Recent advances in deep thinking models have demonstrated remarkable reasoning capabilities on mathematical and coding tasks.

item.title: RapidPoseTriangulation: Multi-view Multi-person Whole-body Human Pose Triangulation in a Millisecond
item.description: The integration of multi-view imaging and pose estimation represents a significant advance in computer vision applications, offering new possibilities for understanding human movement and interactions.

item.title: VBench-2.0: Advancing Video Generation Benchmark Suite for Intrinsic Faithfulness
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce VBench-2. 0, a next-generation benchmark designed to automatically evaluate video generative models for their intrinsic faithfulness.

item.title: Large Language Model Agent: A Survey on Methodology, Applications and Challenges
item.description: The era of intelligent agents is upon us, driven by revolutionary advancements in large language models.

item.title: On Large Multimodal Models as Open-World Image Classifiers
item.description: Despite this remarkable capability, most existing studies on LMM classification performance are surprisingly limited in scope, often assuming a closed-world setting with a predefined set of categories.

item.title: Tune It Up: Music Genre Transfer and Prediction
item.description: In this study, we adapt and improve CycleGAN model to perform music style transfer on Jazz and Classic genres.

item.title: OpenHuEval: Evaluating Large Language Model on Hungarian Specifics
item.description: We introduce OpenHuEval, the first benchmark for LLMs focusing on the Hungarian language and specifics.

item.title: Reward Design for Reinforcement Learning Agents
item.description: Second, we build on this teacher-driven approach by introducing a novel method for adaptive interpretable reward design.

item.title: Barrier-Free Microhabitats: Self-Organized Seclusion in Microbial Communities
item.description: Bacteria frequently colonize natural microcavities such as gut crypts, plant apoplasts, and soil pores.

item.title: Dual-Task Learning for Dead Tree Detection and Segmentation with Hybrid Self-Attention U-Nets in Aerial Imagery
item.description: Mapping standing dead trees is critical for assessing forest health, monitoring biodiversity, and mitigating wildfire risks, for which aerial imagery has proven useful.

item.title: As easy as PIE: understanding when pruning causes language models to disagree
item.description: However, when looking at how individual data points are affected by pruning, it turns out that a particular subset of data points always bears most of the brunt (in terms of reduced accuracy) when pruning, but this effect goes unnoticed when reporting the mean accuracy of all data points.

item.title: PyUAT: Open-source Python framework for efficient and scalable cell tracking
item.description: Tracking individual cells in live-cell imaging provides fundamental insights, inevitable for studying causes and consequences of phenotypic heterogeneity, responses to changing environmental conditions or stressors.
